00022 /// @defgroup cpBody cpBody
00023 /// Chipmunk's rigid body type. Rigid bodies hold the physical properties of an object like
00024 /// it's mass, and position and velocity of it's center of gravity. They don't have an shape on their own.
00025 /// They are given a shape by creating collision shapes (cpShape) that point to the body.
00026 /// @{
00027 
00028 /// Rigid body velocity update function type.
00029 typedef void (*cpBodyVelocityFunc)(cpBody *body, cpVect gravity, cpFloat damping, cpFloat dt);
00030 /// Rigid body position update function type.
00031 typedef void (*cpBodyPositionFunc)(cpBody *body, cpFloat dt);
00032 
00033 /// Used internally to track information on the collision graph.
00034 /// @private
00035 typedef struct cpComponentNode {
00036         cpBody *root;
00037         cpBody *next;
00038         cpFloat idleTime;
00039 } cpComponentNode;
00040 
00041 /// Chipmunk's rigid body struct.
00042 struct cpBody {
00043         /// Function that is called to integrate the body's velocity. (Defaults to cpBodyUpdateVelocity)
00044         cpBodyVelocityFunc velocity_func;
00045         
00046         /// Function that is called to integrate the body's position. (Defaults to cpBodyUpdatePosition)
00047         cpBodyPositionFunc position_func;
00048         
00049         /// Mass of the body.
00050         /// Must agree with cpBody.m_inv! Use cpBodySetMass() when changing the mass for this reason.
00051         cpFloat m;
00052         /// Mass inverse.
00053         cpFloat m_inv;
00054         
00055         /// Moment of inertia of the body.
00056         /// Must agree with cpBody.i_inv! Use cpBodySetMoment() when changing the moment for this reason.
00057         cpFloat i;
00058         /// Moment of inertia inverse.
00059         cpFloat i_inv;
00060         
00061         /// Position of the rigid body's center of gravity.
00062         cpVect p;
00063         /// Velocity of the rigid body's center of gravity.
00064         cpVect v;
00065         /// Force acting on the rigid body's center of gravity.
00066         cpVect f;
00067         
00068         /// Rotation of the body around it's center of gravity in radians.
00069         /// Must agree with cpBody.rot! Use cpBodySetAngle() when changing the angle for this reason.
00070         cpFloat a;
00071         /// Angular velocity of the body around it's center of gravity in radians/second.
00072         cpFloat w;
00073         /// Torque applied to the body around it's center of gravity.
00074         cpFloat t;
00075         
00076         /// Cached unit length vector representing the angle of the body.
00077         /// Used for fast rotations using cpvrotate().
00078         cpVect rot;
00079         
00080         /// User definable data pointer.
00081         /// Generally this points to your the game object class so you can access it
00082         /// when given a cpBody reference in a callback.
00083         cpDataPointer data;
00084         
00085         /// Maximum velocity allowed when updating the velocity.
00086         cpFloat v_limit;
00087         /// Maximum rotational rate (in radians/second) allowed when updating the angular velocity.
00088         cpFloat w_limit;
00089         
00090         CP_PRIVATE(cpVect v_bias);
00091         CP_PRIVATE(cpFloat w_bias);
00092         
00093         CP_PRIVATE(cpSpace *space);
00094         
00095         CP_PRIVATE(cpShape *shapeList);
00096         CP_PRIVATE(cpArbiter *arbiterList);
00097         CP_PRIVATE(cpConstraint *constraintList);
00098         
00099         CP_PRIVATE(cpComponentNode node);
00100 };
00101 
00102 /// Allocate a cpBody.
00103 cpBody *cpBodyAlloc(void);
00104 /// Initialize a cpBody.
00105 cpBody *cpBodyInit(cpBody *body, cpFloat m, cpFloat i);
00106 /// Allocate and initialize a cpBody.
00107 cpBody *cpBodyNew(cpFloat m, cpFloat i);
00108 
00109 /// Initialize a static cpBody.
00110 cpBody *cpBodyInitStatic(cpBody *body);
00111 /// Allocate and initialize a static cpBody.
00112 cpBody *cpBodyNewStatic();
00113 
00114 /// Destroy a cpBody.
00115 void cpBodyDestroy(cpBody *body);
00116 /// Destroy and free a cpBody.
00117 void cpBodyFree(cpBody *body);
00118 
00119 /// Check that the properties of a body is sane. (Only in debug mode)
00120 #ifdef NDEBUG
00121         #define cpBodyAssertSane(body)
00122 #else
00123         void cpBodySanityCheck(cpBody *body);
00124         #define cpBodyAssertSane(body) cpBodySanityCheck(body)
00125 #endif
00126 
00127 // Defined in cpSpace.c
00128 /// Wake up a sleeping or idle body.
00129 void cpBodyActivate(cpBody *body);
00130 /// Wake up any sleeping or idle bodies touching a static body.
00131 void cpBodyActivateStatic(cpBody *body, cpShape *filter);
00132 
00133 /// Force a body to fall asleep immediately.
00134 void cpBodySleep(cpBody *body);
00135 /// Force a body to fall asleep immediately along with other bodies in a group.
00136 void cpBodySleepWithGroup(cpBody *body, cpBody *group);
00137 
00138 /// Returns true if the body is sleeping.
00139 static inline cpBool cpBodyIsSleeping(const cpBody *body)
00140 {
00141         return (CP_PRIVATE(body->node).root != ((cpBody*)0));
00142 }
00143 
00144 /// Returns true if the body is static.
00145 static inline cpBool cpBodyIsStatic(const cpBody *body)
00146 {
00147         return CP_PRIVATE(body->node).idleTime == INFINITY;
00148 }
00149 
00150 /// Returns true if the body has not been added to a space.
00151 static inline cpBool cpBodyIsRogue(const cpBody *body)
00152 {
00153         return (body->CP_PRIVATE(space) == ((cpSpace*)0));
00154 }
00155 
00156 
00157 #define CP_DefineBodyStructGetter(type, member, name) \
00158 static inline type cpBodyGet##name(const cpBody *body){return body->member;}
00159 
00160 #define CP_DefineBodyStructSetter(type, member, name) \
00161 static inline void cpBodySet##name(cpBody *body, const type value){ \
00162         cpBodyActivate(body); \
00163         cpBodyAssertSane(body); \
00164         body->member = value; \
00165 }
00166 
00167 #define CP_DefineBodyStructProperty(type, member, name) \
00168 CP_DefineBodyStructGetter(type, member, name) \
00169 CP_DefineBodyStructSetter(type, member, name)
00170

00172 /// Set the mass of a body.
00173 void cpBodySetMass(cpBody *body, cpFloat m);
00174 
00175 CP_DefineBodyStructGetter(cpFloat, i, Moment);
00176 /// Set the moment of a body.
00177 void cpBodySetMoment(cpBody *body, cpFloat i);
00178 
00179 CP_DefineBodyStructGetter(cpVect, p, Pos);
00180 /// Set the position of a body.
00181 void cpBodySetPos(cpBody *body, cpVect pos);
00182 CP_DefineBodyStructProperty(cpVect, v, Vel);
00183 CP_DefineBodyStructProperty(cpVect, f, Force);
00184 CP_DefineBodyStructGetter(cpFloat, a, Angle);
00185 /// Set the angle of a body.
00186 void cpBodySetAngle(cpBody *body, cpFloat a);
00187 CP_DefineBodyStructProperty(cpFloat, w, AngVel);
00188 CP_DefineBodyStructProperty(cpFloat, t, Torque);
00189 CP_DefineBodyStructGetter(cpVect, rot, Rot);
00190 CP_DefineBodyStructProperty(cpFloat, v_limit, VelLimit);
00191 CP_DefineBodyStructProperty(cpFloat, w_limit, AngVelLimit);
00192 CP_DefineBodyStructProperty(cpDataPointer, data, UserData);
00193 
00194 /// Default Integration functions.
00195 void cpBodyUpdateVelocity(cpBody *body, cpVect gravity, cpFloat damping, cpFloat dt);
00196 void cpBodyUpdatePosition(cpBody *body, cpFloat dt);
00197 
00198 /// Convert body relative/local coordinates to absolute/world coordinates.
00199 static inline cpVect cpBodyLocal2World(const cpBody *body, const cpVect v)
00200 {
00201         return cpvadd(body->p, cpvrotate(v, body->rot));
00202 }
00203 
00204 /// Convert body absolute/world coordinates to  relative/local coordinates.
00205 static inline cpVect cpBodyWorld2Local(const cpBody *body, const cpVect v)
00206 {
00207         return cpvunrotate(cpvsub(v, body->p), body->rot);
00208 }
00209 
00210 /// Set the forces and torque or a body to zero.
00211 void cpBodyResetForces(cpBody *body);
00212 /// Apply an force (in world coordinates) to the body at a point relative to the center of gravity (also in world coordinates).
00213 void cpBodyApplyForce(cpBody *body, const cpVect f, const cpVect r);
00214 /// Apply an impulse (in world coordinates) to the body at a point relative to the center of gravity (also in world coordinates).
00215 void cpBodyApplyImpulse(cpBody *body, const cpVect j, const cpVect r);
00216 
00217 /// Get the kinetic energy of a body.
00218 static inline cpFloat cpBodyKineticEnergy(const cpBody *body)
00219 {
00220         // Need to do some fudging to avoid NaNs
00221         cpFloat vsq = cpvdot(body->v, body->v);
00222         cpFloat wsq = body->w*body->w;
00223         return (vsq ? vsq*body->m : 0.0f) + (wsq ? wsq*body->i : 0.0f);
00224 }
00225 
00226 /// Body/shape iterator callback function type. 
00227 typedef void (*cpBodyShapeIteratorFunc)(cpBody *body, cpShape *shape, void *data);
00228 /// Call @c func once for each shape attached to @c body and added to the space.
00229 void cpBodyEachShape(cpBody *body, cpBodyShapeIteratorFunc func, void *data);
00230 
00231 /// Body/constraint iterator callback function type. 
00232 typedef void (*cpBodyConstraintIteratorFunc)(cpBody *body, cpConstraint *constraint, void *data);
00233 /// Call @c func once for each constraint attached to @c body and added to the space.
00234 void cpBodyEachConstraint(cpBody *body, cpBodyConstraintIteratorFunc func, void *data);
00235 
00236 /// Body/arbiter iterator callback function type. 
00237 typedef void (*cpBodyArbiterIteratorFunc)(cpBody *body, cpArbiter *arbiter, void *data);
00238 /// Call @c func once for each arbiter that is currently active on the body.
00239 void cpBodyEachArbiter(cpBody *body, cpBodyArbiterIteratorFunc func, void *data);
